Shiraz-i-Hind

The Sharqi dynasty was founded by Khwaja-i-Jahan Malik Sarwar, a vizier of the Tughlaq Sultan. He established an independent sultanate in Jaunpur (Uttar Pradesh). During his reign, Jaunpur became such a great center of culture, education, and architecture that it was called 'Shiraz-i-Hind' (Shiraz of India).

ЁЯПЧя╕П
Sharqi Style of Architecture

The Sharqi Sultans developed a unique style by blending Hindu and Islamic architectural elements. The Atala Masjid, Lal Darwaza Masjid, and Jama Masjid are excellent examples of this. The grandeur and artistry of these buildings continue to attract tourists even today.

тЪФя╕П
Conflict with the Lodis

The Sharqi Sultans (Ibrahim Shah, Hussain Shah) had continuous conflicts with the Lodi Sultans of Delhi. Ultimately, in 1479, Bahlul Lodi defeated Hussain Shah Sharqi and reintegrated Jaunpur into the Delhi Sultanate, marking the end of this glorious dynasty.
